keyFactors.title: Elite Recent Scoring Form
keyFactors.description: Averaging 31.25 PPG over last 4 games including all OVER 26.5. Red-hot stretch indicated elevated scoring role.

keyFactors.title: Previous Meeting Blueprint
keyFactors.description: 34 points vs same Sacramento team on November 3 (8 days prior). Established successful scoring blueprint against this defense.

keyFactors.title: Sacramento League-Worst Defense
keyFactors.description: Kings ranked 27th in defensive rating (111.5), 28th in points allowed. Recently allowed 144 to Minnesota—porous interior defense.

keyFactors.title: Elite Shooting Efficiency
keyFactors.description: 64.4% FG overall through 9 games, absurd 78.6% on two-pointers. Healthy wrist enabling elite touch around rim.

keyFactors.title: Sabonis Playing Injured
keyFactors.description: Domantas Sabonis clutching side throughout game, unable to provide usual resistance. Removed primary interior defender.

riskFactors: Blowout could limit minutes in 4th quarter
National TV showcase might change gameplan
Sacramento could deploy zone defense to limit interior scoring

quarterBreakdown.description: Game was competitive early, Kings led by 1. Jokic established interior dominance with floaters and hook shots.
Nuggets took lead for good with 1:45 left in quarter. Jokic efficient around rim, exploiting Sabonis's injury.
Hit 27 points at 2:14 mark, OVER CASHES ✓. Continued dominating with tip-ins and layups. Made only one shot outside paint entire game.
Nuggets pulled away with 16-2 run. Jokic added to total, finished with historic 35 pts, 15 reb on 84.2% shooting.

gameResults.whenCleared: Late Q3 at 2:14 remaining (27 points), finished with 35
gameResults.shotChartExcellence: Made only ONE shot outside the paint entire game (late 3-pointer). Dominated with floaters, hook shots, tip-ins, layups around rim. At halftime, only miss was buzzer-beater half-court heave.
gameResults.historicEfficiency: 16-19 FG (84.2%) - first career game with 35+ points, 15+ rebounds, and 80%+ shooting. Complete mastery of weakened interior defense.

whatWentRight.title: Recent Form Was Predictive
whatWentRight.description: 31.25 PPG in last 4 games indicated current elevated scoring role. This was sustainable form, not random variance.

whatWentRight.title: Sacramento Defensive Futility Exploited
whatWentRight.description: 27th in rating, 28th in points allowed. Kings allowed 276 points in previous 2 games—completely porous defense.

whatWentRight.title: Sabonis Injury Removed Resistance
whatWentRight.description: Primary interior defender playing injured, clutching side. Unable to provide usual resistance to Jokic's drives.

whatWentRight.title: Previous Meeting Provided Blueprint
whatWentRight.description: 34 points vs Sacramento 8 days prior showed this was repeatable success, not one-time fluke.

whatWentRight.title: Historic Efficiency
whatWentRight.description: 84.2% shooting (16-19 FG) showcased complete mismatch. Kings had no answer for Jokic's touch around rim.

statisticalContext.historicalContext: First career game with 35+ pts, 15+ reb, 80%+ FG. Historic dominance.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was expected outcome based on matchup and form. Elite scorer on hot streak (31.25 PPG) facing league-worst defense (27th rating) with injured primary defender = massive edge. Variance worked in our favor, but edge was real.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV (+5 cents). Line moved toward OVER as market recognized value. Got slightly better price than closing.

keyTakeaways: Recent form trumps season averages: Jokic's 4-game scoring tear (31.25 PPG) was far more predictive than season average (25.2)
Matchup history provides blueprint: 34 points vs same opponent 8 days prior indicated repeatable success
Opponent defensive struggles are exploitable: Sacramento's league-worst defense (27th rating) wasn't random variance
Health matters: Sabonis playing injured removed primary interior resistance
Elite efficiency showcased complete mismatch: 84.2% shooting was historic dominance
National TV games incentivize star performances: NBC showcase created motivation for aggressive play
verdict: Perfect convergence of hot form, favorable matchup, and opponent weakness. Grade: A+
